malicious_clones.name: Grok Quick Prompt
malicious_clones.evidence: The extension 'Grok Quick Prompt' impersonates the xAI brand by using 'Grok' as the first word of its title and adopting an icon that mimics the official brand's visual identity (white letter on a black square). While xAI has updated its logo to a more stylized 'Saturn-like' G, the extension's choice of a white 'G' on black is a clear attempt to look like an official utility. According to xAI's official brand guidelines, the use of 'Grok' in any app title is strictly prohibited for third-party developers. This combination of visual imitation and unauthorized use of the brand name in the title constitutes visual deception and keyword stuffing.
red_flags: Use of brand name 'Grok' as the primary keyword in the title
Icon mimics official xAI black-and-white color scheme and 'G' monogram
Violates xAI brand guidelines which prohibit using 'Grok' in app titles
Extremely low user count (48) for a brand of this scale

malicious_clones.name: Grok everywhere
malicious_clones.evidence: The extension 'Grok everywhere' is impersonating the xAI brand 'Grok'. Official xAI branding utilizes a minimalist white forward slash (/) on a black background as its primary logo, which this extension has copied exactly. While there have been reports of an official 'Ask Grok' extension by xAI, this specific version has only 17 users and is listed under an 'Unknown' developer. According to the classification logic, using the brand's visual identity (100% similarity) in conjunction with the brand name in the title to provide the brand's primary service constitutes a MALICIOUS_CLONE due to visual deception and keyword exploitation.
red_flags: Identical use of official brand logo
Use of brand name as the primary title ('Grok everywhere')
Extremely low user count (17) for a major global AI brand
Unknown developer providing a core brand service

malicious_clones.evidence: The extension 'Awesome Grok & Grokipedia' uses the official brand imagery of xAI's Grok. According to official brand evolution history, Grok adopted a specific 'Saturn-inspired' or 'black hole' monogram logo in early 2025, which matches the provided extension icon exactly. While the extension does not explicitly use the word 'Official' in its title, its use of the primary corporate logo combined with the brand names 'Grok' and 'Grokipedia' (another official xAI product) constitutes a malicious clone under the specified criteria because it uses the brand name in the title with a highly imitative icon, creating a deceptive impression of being an official tool.
red_flags: Uses official 2025 Grok logo as its extension icon
Uses brand names 'Grok' and 'Grokipedia' in the title
Impersonates the visual identity of xAI's products without authorization
Target brand (xAI) does not offer an official Chrome extension

malicious_clones.name: Grok Sidebar
malicious_clones.evidence: The 'Grok Sidebar' extension impersonates the Grok brand by using the official 'xAI' monogram logo as its icon. According to official brand guidelines and search results, Grok is owned by xAI (Elon Musk) and is officially available via grok.com, iOS, and Android; no official Chrome extension is mentioned. The extension's use of the official corporate logo in conjunction with the product name 'Grok' in the title is a clear case of visual deception intended to make the tool appear as an official integration from xAI. This combination of visual copying and brand name usage without authorization classifies it as a MALICIOUS_CLONE.
red_flags: Uses official xAI corporate logo without authorization
Uses trademarked brand name 'Grok' in the title
Official brand presence (grok.com) does not list a Chrome extension
Suspiciously low user count (32)

malicious_clones.name: Grokipedia Search Shortcut
malicious_clones.evidence: The extension 'Grokipedia Search Shortcut' impersonates the 'grok' brand by utilizing its trademarked product name (Grokipedia) and mimicking its visual identity. xAI officially owns Grok and the Grokipedia encyclopedia. The extension's icon is a derivative of the official xAI/Grok 'slash' and circular monogram logos. According to the classification criteria, using the brand name in the title in conjunction with an imitative icon (visual deception and keyword stuffing) constitutes a MALICIOUS_CLONE. While the developer includes an 'unofficial' disclaimer in the description, this does not permit the unauthorized use of brand imagery and trademarks for user-facing identification.
red_flags: Uses the official product name 'Grokipedia' in the primary title
Imitative diagonal slash icon geometry
Low user count (29) for a search tool of a major brand
Developer is unaffiliated with xAI

malicious_clones.name: Grok Chatbot
malicious_clones.evidence: The extension 'Grok Chatbot' is impersonating the brand 'Grok' owned by xAI. Analysis of the official brand identity reveals that the initial logo for Grok was a bold, minimalist black square with a white forward slash; the extension's icon is an exact copy of this branding. Furthermore, the description claims the product is 'Grok-3 based on X AI,' which directly implies it is an official tool from Elon Musk's xAI. There is no evidence of an official Grok extension in the Chrome Web Store, and this version has a low user count (222) and an 'Unknown' developer, which are typical traits of unauthorized clones. The combination of the official logo and the direct brand name usage constitutes visual and textual deception.
red_flags: Uses the official original logo of the brand (black square with white slash)
Claims to be 'Grok-3 based on X AI' in the description
Uses the brand name as the primary title ('Grok Chatbot')
Lacks any 'unofficial' or third-party disclaimer in the metadata

malicious_clones.name: AutoGrok - Auto send Grok prompts and download images/videos
malicious_clones.evidence: The extension 'AutoGrok' uses the official logo of the Grok brand (owned by xAI) which consists of a stylized circular monogram with a diagonal slash. According to the brand's visual identity evolution in 2025, this specific imagery is the official trademarked logo for the Grok AI. Using this logo alongside the brand name in the title creates visual deception, implying an official connection or authorization that does not exist. While it does not explicitly claim to be 'official', the combination of brand name and brand logo meets the criteria for a MALICIOUS_CLONE due to the deceptive use of the brand's visual identity.
red_flags: Uses official brand logo
Uses brand name in title
Keyword stuffing in description

malicious_clones.name: XAI
malicious_clones.evidence: The extension 'XAI' is a malicious clone designed to impersonate the 'grok' brand and its owner, xAI. It uses the brand owner's exact name as the extension title and adopts the signature forward slash ('/') logo which is a central part of the Grok/xAI visual identity. Furthermore, the description claims the tool uses 'Grok Twitter AI' to streamline workflows, creating a false impression of an official xAI product. Google Search confirms that xAI (the developer of Grok) has official apps for Web, iOS, and Android, but does not offer an official Chrome extension. The combination of name impersonation, visual imitation of the slash symbol, and unauthorized use of product names indicates a clear intent to deceive users.
red_flags: Uses exact company name 'XAI' as the extension title
Uses the brand's signature forward slash symbol in the icon
Extremely low user count (119) for a major AI brand
Mentions 'Grok Twitter AI' in the description to imply official integration
Official website (x.ai) does not list any Chrome extension

malicious_clones.name: Ask Grok
malicious_clones.evidence: The 'Ask Grok' extension is impersonating the Grok brand by utilizing the exact visual identity of its owner, xAI. Search results confirm that the official xAI/Grok logo is a minimalist black square with a white forward slash, which is identical to the extension's icon. While no official Chrome extension exists for Grok, this extension uses the brand's name and its distinctive logo to create the false impression of being an official tool or endorsed by xAI. Under the provided framework, the combination of the brand name in the title and the use of the brand's exact logo constitutes visual deception, categorizing it as a MALICIOUS_CLONE.
red_flags: Direct use of the official xAI/Grok slash logo
Uses the trademarked brand name 'Grok' as the primary title
Visual deception through exact replication of brand owner's minimalist logo
Keyword-focused title combined with brand imagery to imply official status
